title:
Time-periodic (Floquet) systems in classical wave physics and
  engineering: Opinion
authors: Francesco Monticone, Dimitrios Sounas, Matteo Ciabattoni
abstract:
The study of classical waves in time-periodic systems is experiencing a
resurgence of interest, motivated by their rich physics and the new engineering
opportunities they enable, with several analogies to parallel efforts in other
branches of physics, e.g., Floquet-engineered quantum materials and time
crystals. Here, we first briefly review some of the most prominent features
enabled by time-periodic modulations, and we then focus on two specific areas,
namely, time-varying systems to break reciprocity and to overcome various
theoretical limitations and performance bounds, discussing their current
status, challenges, and opportunities.
